title: Arghese Alengada Police Report 2019-2020 (Alameda Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All police reports from the case against Arghese Alengada, also known as Father George  at St. Joseph Basilica, in Alameda and Oakland, Alameda County, California. Please provide the records from January 1st, 2019 through September 18, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victoria Anderer

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: J. Chou email logs
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to Illinois Freedom of Information act, I request the following:

A log of all emails sent to or from Jadine Chou, CPS Chief of Safety and Security, between January 2, 2021 to January 1, 2023, and for which "nasro" or "NASRO" appears in the subject line, attachment file name, or email body/text, or which appears in the domain of an email recipient or sender (e.g., <name>@nasro.org). Please also include emails for which Jadine Chou is copied (cc or bcc) for this time span.

I am not requesting the emails themselves; this is a request for email metadata, including senders, recipients, date and time, subject line, and any attachments.

This is a non-commercial request. If there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ICLS 140/6(c).

I prefer for the responsive records to be sent electronically. Please feel free to contact me with any questions or if clarification is needed.
Thank you for your assistance.

Lucy Parsons Labs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Carl Kaysen
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Carl Kaysen (March 5, 1920 - February 8, 2010). Proof of death is not required as his death wqs widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/20/us/20kaysen.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Oscar Seborer
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Oscar Seborer (June 4, 1921 - April 23, 2015). Seborer was an active Soviet intelligence asset from 1941 to 1951, identified in Venona project intercepts under the code name "Godsend". Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Civic Consulting Alliance's plan for base camps for asylum seekers

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

any reports from the Civic Consulting Alliance proposing or describing base camps for asylum seekers in Chicago. 

the Mayor of Chicago described this plan in a September 7th, 2023 article in the Sun-Times: https://chicago.suntimes.com/fran-spielman-show/2023/9/7/23863501/migrant-crisis-immigration-chicago-police-stations-shelters-tents-camps-brandon-johnson

the Mayor's discussion of this plan makes a 7(1)f exemption unavailable.

title: Responses to March 1, 2023 email from Ryan Kelly about getting pickpocketed at the meeting.
tags: donovan day village of fox lake

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Responses to March 1, 2023 email from Ryan Kelly about getting pickpocketed at the meeting.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. All responses to the email from Ryan Kelly dated Wednesday, March 1, 2023; subject: $100 reward for missing proximity key fob
where he writes he was pickpocketed at the meeting. This request is for responses from dayd@foxlake.org; noonank@foxlake.org; chernichj@foxlake.org from 
their village email and personal emails.  

2. All emails to and from dayd@foxlake.org; noonank@foxlake.org; chernichj@foxlake.org; and kellyr@foxlake.org about key fobs, pens, board meetings, recording devices, bugs, village offices, village rooms, village buildings, trustees, mayor, other employees from February 1, 2023 through May 1, 2023 from village emails and personal emails.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carolyn

title: Questions and comments texted to Gov. Phil Murphy

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

An electronic list of all comments, questions and other message sent to the (732) 605-5455  text number promoted by Gov. Phil Murphy in the following message and press release.

 https://twitter.com/GovMurphy/status/1694696068578254941?s=20
https://www.nj.gov/governor/news/news/562023/20230824b.shtml

I ask that all database columns be included in the release. I ask that the response be in a common spreadsheet format, such as CSV or XLS.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MO Joint Task Force Info
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list detailing the names of currently active and previously active (if applicable) Organized Crime Drug Enforcement Task Forces and State and Local Task Forces active in Missouri from January 1 of 2021 to the date of this request. Please provide the name of the task force with contact information and detail of timeframe for when active or inactive (if applicable).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Public Records Request Log 2017-2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Log of requests submitted under the California Public Records Act to the Governor's office that lists the date of request, the requester's name, the requester's organizational affiliation, a description of the request and whether or not the request was ultimately fulfilled. Ideally I would like this information for the period from 2016 to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sally Jones

communications.subject: RE: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Public Records Request Log 2017-2023
communications.communication:
“Ms. Jones, please clarify your request and consider editing it to address the correct state agency.  As written, you’ve requested records requested according to California state law.  You’ve also requested requests received by the governor’s office.    This agency is not subject to California state law nor do we maintain any such records on behalf of a governor’s office.

Additionally, please send your request directly to our records custodian a GC@KSDE.ORG<mailto:GC@KSDE.ORG>.”

Thank you!
Cheryl


[cid:image001.png@01D9EA0A.ED8C0790]
Cheryl D. Austin
Legal Assistant
Office of General Counsel
(785) 296-3204
caustin@ksde.org
www.ksde.org<http://www.ksde.org/>

Kansas leads the world in the success of each student.
The Kansas State Department of Education does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the nondiscrimination policies: KSDE General Counsel, Office of General Counsel, KSDE, Landon State Office Building, 900 S.W. Jackson, Suite 102, Topeka, KS 66612, (785) 296-3201.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of Memoranda of Agreement (MOAs), Memoranda of Understanding (MOUs), contract guidelines, charter guidelines or records documenting guidelines for collaborative agreement between your agency and any local, state or federal law enforcement multijurisdictional task forces, committees, coalitions, councils or commissions for fiscal years of both 2022 and 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

title: After Action Review Report-2020 BLM Protests

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: After Action Review Report-2020 BLM Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

a copy of an After Action Review Report in regards to the 2020 George Floyd/Black Lives Matter protests. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Through this request, I am gathering information on the copies of the three lawsuits because this information is being sought on behalf of NYCity News Service for dissemination to the general public.

Please waive any applicable fees. Release of the information is in the public interest because it will contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations and activities. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is of timely value, I would appreciate your communicating with me by phone or email, if you have questions regarding this request.

Please provide expedited processing of this request which concerns a matter of urgency. As a journalist, I am primarily engaged in disseminating information. The public has an urgent need for information about the copies of the three lawsuits because I certify that my statements concerning the need for expedited processing are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.

Thank you in advance for your time. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within five business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Brianna Knibbs

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Brianna Knibbs.

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- All contracts with Shot Spotter ( SoundThinking ) since 2016.  
- Records showing the full roster of CPD employees, their salaries, and badge numbers.  Please provide this in a digital format like XLS or CSV.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P043727-091723
communications.communication:
Dear Kevin Hawkins: 
Our office received your open records request pursuant to Missouri's Sunshine Law, Chapter 610, RSMo. Your request has been assigned number P043727-091723. The Patrol is committed to adhering to the Sunshine Law and to ensuring that the public obtains access to open records that are not otherwise closed by law. The Sunshine Law requires each public agency to adhere to certain standards. This letter is designed to ensure that you understand our process for fulfilling your records request. Three Business Day Notice Requirement: 
The requested records are not immediately available for dissemination or inspection. The Patrol is required to notify you that additional research time will be required to fulfill the request. This correspondence satisfies the Sunshine Law's notice requirement within the required three business day period. Section 610.023.3, RSMo. 
 Additional Research Time is Required: 
The Patrol receives thousands of open records requests each month. Our Patrol Records Division personnel are dedicated to meeting the intent of Missouri's Sunshine Law and strive to respond to each request in a timely manner. The Patrol operates in all 114 Missouri counties and the independent city of St. Louis. Accordingly, many records maintained by the agency are not centrally located within, or immediately accessible to, the Patrol's Custodian of Records in Jefferson City. Our staff must research your request and ensure that we have captured all responsive records  ̶  regardless of their location within the agency. The research process is time-consuming, but we will make every effort to expedite your request. Estimated Time for Completion: 
The majority of our requests are fulfilled within thirty business days. Some requests require additional research time due to their scope or complexity. Our team will conduct an initial review of your request. If we estimate that the request will be fulfilled within thirty business days, we will not send an updated time estimate. However, if we estimate that the request will take longer than thirty business days, we will provide an updated time estimate that provides a detailed justification for the additional research time. Billing: 
As it relates to billing, Missouri law allows the Patrol to charge fees for copies and research time. Specifically, "[r]esearch time required for fulfilling records requests may be charged at the actual cost of research time." Section 610.026, RSMo. The Missouri Supreme Court recently determined that "staff time is the time required to provide access to public records maintained on computer facilities, recording tapes or disks, videotapes or films, pictures, maps, slides, graphics, illustrations or similar audio or visual items". Gross v. Parson, 624 S.W.3d 877, 884-89 (Mo. 2021) (internal quotations omitted). 
The Patrol will never bill you for redaction time or any research time conducted by our legal staff. You will only be charged for copies and staff research time as permitted by Missouri law. Please let us know if you have questions related to the billing estimate. 
Our team will forward a bill estimate to your attention once we have calculated the permissible costs and fees. The Patrol will not provide the responsive records until receipt of payment. Section 610.026.2, RSMo. 
We appreciate your patience as we review, research, and fulfill your open records request. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. If you wish to withdraw or clarify your request, or if you have questions, please call our office at (573) 526-6146, or (573) 526-6167. 
 
Sincerely, 
Gerard G. Callahan 
Custodian of Records 
 
Login Link: https://mshp.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/Login.aspx

title: Fusion Center MOUs + MOAs (St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Fusion Center MOUs + MOAs (St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the current or most recent memorandum of agreement (MOA) or memorandum of understanding (MOU) between your law enforcement agency and any fusion centers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Kevin Hawkins, 
 
Thank you for submitting a public records request to the City of St. Louis OR the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department. 
 
If you did not submit your request through a Public Records Portal, an account has been created for you and you can now track the progress of this request, communicate directly with staff and receive most open records electronically. 
 
Please note, you can use the same Log-in for the City of St. Louis Public Records Portal OR the (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HTlIccejzKd5Zy5e17XkUYReoC4lkjH7N3tXeckovooOjj0VOMfykmcmcgV2k3SuZKU0Etu6mmdGvJDTiPvjGDk-3Dgmu1_48lzBjicnLn8rBhKoRN5Oit561j6ODtjgPI4Q7i9N4wsyVEmCWP2p3lJG2xOp9wAB3pcD8SVDf3lVY0gGAcB-2BwY8sYHAoKE-2FjMPiVSnP8k94C6V451dog3-2BDIKYQ3b-2FrRIZVL4CwBf0TS5bZTeL0jhSpCabdXXkWKyTdHuhCh9Yv6cpJacFOyS-2BMSWaAzDW-2BUizLeVOGCHqtKAxxojk0cM5SqVdIEdq5j5fO4ghznFo-3D) SLMPD Public Records Portal. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HXKlOqhFxFGl1qpcWGCRpN2p6FkZS8KJuLPxrqfVx7pC4ifcQUDRHAPLXCZCw6mBPVjOLA5bgFu4l81vSD9DE28-3D-mgZ_48lzBjicnLn8rBhKoRN5Oit561j6ODtjgPI4Q7i9N4wsyVEmCWP2p3lJG2xOp9wAB3pcD8SVDf3lVY0gGAcB-2B0QQDSVzdTGsgvrUkFEUMpH1-2BnTn2HNEUO-2FBazKgffaVwHqiYIFXOnCuwkTG-2FX6zODlINvHmNA5jzC9kyHLnh-2FEztLxd6GZaSFrX-2FcBR0aP7y-2FdlXWAd3pRVO6-2Ftw8hydWTjxEwwP6n5RVb42FyXbpY-3D) 
 
 Your Login ID is:  152056-38054096@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HUV8yXyCwIyA2ujI90R-2Fti72wu0AntPMCL0xU0-2FKwKTDzK4JKBQ8onVU8qAaEtUza5I-2FlOu4bv5ItknemgX1woA-3Dv5Sj_48lzBjicnLn8rBhKoRN5Oit561j6ODtjgPI4Q7i9N4wsyVEmCWP2p3lJG2xOp9wAB3pcD8SVDf3lVY0gGAcB-2B85z2-2B3mQvzA-2F0StxrC53x7fo-2Fo2B9us9vJSYxCWVtwqdKd5xVcOIAVsPGdzNHz2lh8KLMvKMU9Lyz2IGlaDyWoYIc-2FRjuLfhF2a-2Fxi-2Bt6CDe2P-2F63y-2FvGrpqi69p0MwMJhodcyXHTLW8Dcw-2FhDqpNw-3D) 
 
Once your email address has been verified, log-in to the appropriate portal and go to My Records Center to update your account information, track this request and receive your records once they are available. 
 
 
Thank you!

communications.subject: SLMPD - Public Records Request :: P028727-091723
communications.communication:
Dear Kevin Hawkins: 
Thank you for submitting a records request to the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department.  Your request was given reference number P028727-091723, for tracking purposes. Type of Records Selected: Other Police Record Complaint Number (if applicable): Type of Incident (if applicable): Description of Request (if applicable):   To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the current or most recent memorandum of agreement (MOA) or memorandum of understanding (MOU) between your law enforcement agency and any fusion centers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fst-louis-metropolitan-police-department-671%252Ffusion-center-mous-moas-st-louis-metropolitan-police-department-152056%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAj9WsQ4FuNTZD2Y9DnVAucV28%3A1qi3fN%3AFSfImeJ7iWYC0f3E_mPi2n7l1ro-MLdRa_xH2uo-Yik 
We are currently reviewing your request and will contact you if any additional information is required.  Otherwise, we will proceed with locating and gathering responsive records from various departments.  Once records are located, they will need to be reviewed to determine what may be released at this time.  All records are released in accordance with the Missouri Sunshine Law, Chapter 610 and SLMPD Policy. 
There will be a cost associated with this request, and you will be contacted with more details prior to records being released.  The earliest records are typically available is as follows: 
• Arrest Reports, Background Checks, Crash Reports, Police Calls for Service, Law Enforcement Requests and Non-criminal Police Reports are available within 10 days of submission of your request. 
• Criminal Police Reports, evidentiary material and other non-standard requests are available within 30 days of submission. 
In the event your request will require additional time you will be provided with a detailed explanation of any further delay. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Thank you!

title: FOIL Request for Information on COVID-19 Tests and Masks Distribution to Schools (First Supervisory District Of Erie County And Boces (erie 1))

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Information on COVID-19 Tests and Masks Distribution to Schools (First Supervisory District Of Erie County And Boces (erie 1))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. All communications between the Governor's Office and/or the State Education Department and/or Boards of Cooperative Educational Services (BOCES) regarding the distribution of COVID-19 rapid test kits and N-95 and KN-95 masks to schools, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.
  
2. Records of all requests submitted by school districts and BOCES for COVID-19 rapid test kits and N-95 and KN-95 masks, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.

3. Inventory records detailing the quantities of COVID-19 rapid test kits and N-95 and KN-95 masks that have been delivered to each BOCES for distribution to school districts, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.

4. Any and all guidelines, memos, or advisories issued by the Governor's Office or the New York State Department of Health (DOH) regarding the distribution of COVID-19 rapid test kits and masks to schools, dated from January 1, 2023, to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIL Request for Information on COVID-19 Tests and Masks Distribution to Schools (Sole Supervisory District Of Albany-schoharie-schenectady-saratoga Counties And Boces (capital Region))
